page.title: 02Ecology 1
page.content: Our area is very rich in wildlife.On a typical summer's day these are the common birds you would see: rook, carrion crow, jackdaw, woodpigeon, magpie, blue tit, great tit, hedge sparrow, song thrush, blackbird and chaffinch. By Ashton Brook you can sometimes see mallards flying around. If you are lucky you would see a kestrel or a sparrow hawk hovering and diving down on field mice. You might see a yellow hammer, greenfinch, or goldfinch; and over at Peel Hall there is a resident barn owl. Down Grange Road you can come across spotted wood_ peckers or you can hear them. In some of the ponds in the area (for instance at Dunns Lane) there is lots of life. We have found waterscorpion, caddisfly and much more. Some of the ponds in this area are used as dumping grounds and so is part of the brook.
